InterSpec does not send or receive data external to your device, except when the Maps or External RID features are used.

InterSpec does locally store preferences, spectra you load, saved app states, and use statistics. This information does not leave your device, and can be deleted by removing the user data directory shown above.
When the Google Maps feature is used, the spectrum file location information is sent to Google in order to receive maps of the relevant location.

When the Maps tool is used, map tiles are requested from https://arcgis.com for the area encompassing the GPS coordinates of the radiation measurements, but marking/displaying of the radiation data on the maps is done on your device.
